jobDescription: Overview Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nations largest not-for-profit community-based health system. VNSNY provides a comprehensive array of home- and community-based programs, including health plans, tailored to the needs of high-risk, vulnerable New Yorkers, improving their quality of life. Each day,more than 18,000 VNSNY employees including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, dieticians, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources tomore than35,000 patients, helping them to live the best lives possible. Responsibilities Provides analytical support, detailed documentation of requirements/ business processes/ metrics, coordination and implementation support for Business Intelligence & Analytics projects. Designs analytical approach, drives data collection and analysis, gathers and documents business requirements, workflows etc. and helps bridge the gap between business functions and technical teams. Works under general supervision. Defines core business processes and maps current and future states for redesign projects and assists with solution design. Facilitates and support project meetings as needed. Develops positive working relationships with VNSNY CHOICE leadership. Leads requirement gathering sessions for BI and Analytics projects, organizes Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions with Information Technology (IT), BIA Subject Matter Experts and business users to gather and document requirements. Leads meetings with business stakeholders to discuss and finalize project scope, requirements and escalates risks and roadblocks to the Project Manager. Documents Business Requirements Document (BRD), Use Cases/ scenarios, process flows (work flows) and Test Cases. Documents Business Requirements Document (BRD), Use Cases/ scenarios, process flows (work flows) and Test Cases. Pulls data from systems/ databases and performs data analysis to help with the questions from BIA technical teams or IT Interprets business requirements and helps translate those into technical specs for IT or BIA technical analysts Meets with business users in CHOICE (Executive leadership or CHOICE Operations) to gather Key Process Indicators (KPIs) and metrics, define and document those metrics and work with BIA to facilitate creation of dashboards for business users. Acts as a liaison between CHOICE business and IT to work on data warehouse projects. Participates in ad hoc projects and performs other duties as required. Education: Bachelors Degree in Business or related discipline required. Masters Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration or related field preferred. Experience: Minimum of three years of business analysis/data analysis experience with Health Plan/Managed Care, required. Proficientwriting SQL queries and basicPL/SQLfunctions to pull data and perform data analysis, required.Experience working with data warehouse projects is a plus.Strong communication and business analytical skills required. Ability to work in a team-oriented environment interacting with all levels of staff required.Ability to work autonomously, ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks independently with minimal supervision is required.Strong command of Microsoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint) required. CA2018
